text:
Kolor: bardzo ciemny brunatny, prawie czarny, klarowny.
Piana: obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, wolno opada.
Zapach: sporo aromatów bourbona, beczki, wanilii, sporo kakao, ciemnych suszonych owoców, trochę palonych słodów, alkohol dobrze ukryty.
Smak: średnia pełnia, sporo nut bourbona, beczki, wanilii, trochę słodyczy, nut kakao, ciemnych słodów, lekkie akcenty wędzonki od chilli, lekka goryczka, delikatne pieczenie, raczej od chilli niż od alkoholu, ale przyjemnie rozgrzewa.
Wysycenie: średnie
375 ml bottle. Dark pour. Nose is big and all fudge brownie at first. Big chocolate. Spice. Light chili without heat. Cinnamon. Very pricey. But very good at the same time.

Bottled. A black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, alcohol, and soy sauce. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, alcohol, and soy sauce, leading to a dry roasted finish.
37,5 cl. bottle. A black beer with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, caramel, spice, vanilla, oak, alcohol, yeast, dried fruit, cocao and chocolate.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ - Black pour with thin tan head. Aroma and taste is sweet dark malty with opulent chocolate notes, some caramel and treacle sweetness, resonating bourbon throughout, some dark dried fruit, slight charred smoked burnt malty offset with a sweet vanilla caress, with some rich spices into the finish. Lovely.

37.5 cl bottle. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aroma is roastedmalty, overripe fruity. Dark malty and fruity. Dense malty. Roasted. Wooden. Slight fruity. Wineous and slight phenolic. Dense malty, warming and fruity far finish.

Very good strong extra dark beer. Im not picking up on most of the nuances that are in the description but its still so very good. Almost like an imperial stout maybe minus a little of the body. Overall nor on the sweet side and a sipper.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2017 Bottle at home. Very very dark brown colour, beige creamy head. Rich bourbon, roasted malty nose with chocolate, vanilla, cocoa, marshmallows. Taste is roasted malty espresso, cacao, leather, tobacco, boozy in the end and quite high in bitterness, some chili heat. Lacks a bourbon punch in the taste. Huge body and aftertaste, medium carbonation, soft and creamy mouthfeel.

Draft pour at Savor: An American Craft Beer & Food Experience 2017. Poured a nearly pitch black color - lets just fall it pitch black, with a small, wispy tan head. Aroma was smooth roasted chocolates, dark chocolate bakers chocolate with some vanilla notes. Flavor was very similar. Bourbon shines in this one, light woody notes with some dry cocoa powder dusting.

Wonderful stuff. Musky roast and dark chocolate. Caramel and done coffee, nut. Back pour with good head and lacing. Bitter finish but excellent journey like never ending puppy flights. Creamy consistency. Bottle.

Bottle shared by "hannont". Colour...very dark brown with no head. Nose...raisins, plums and currants with dark chocolate. Palate...tangy, boozy and loaded with dark cherry, dried blueberries and earthy cassis. The mid palate is sweet but the finish is long and only lightly cloying.

Pitch black with small, semi-dense espresso head. Nice lacing. Nose is dark malts, bourbon-like booze, smoked wood, raisins and some cinnamon undertones. Taste is sweet, with bourbon, chocolate, cinnamon and chilies coming to mind. Warming burn with dried prunes and smoked oak in the finish. Medium bodied, low canonation, oily, sticky mouthfeel. Very good, with the only complaint that the bourbon taste overshadows a bit the other flavours.

Bottle 375ml @ yngwie
Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, dried fruits, vanilla, oak, bourbon, cocoa, cardemom and cinnamon. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter with a long warm, dried fruity, vanilla, oak, bourbon, cocoa and cinnamon finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle from K&L. Pours opaque black, small tan head, dissipates fairly quickly, decent lacing. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, cinnamon, oaky, cocoa. Flavor is fully sweet, light bitter, bourbon, cocoa, vanilla, cinnamon, faint chili note. Full body. Xolid.
Bottle @cgarvieuk (May 1st). Pours black with a tan head. Nose is chocolate, sugar candy, fruit cake and spices. Taste is chocolate, woody, spices, big cinnamon, raisins and fruit/christmas cake.

Pours very dark brown with a medium foamy off white head. Aromas of caramel, muscovado sugar, roasted malt, roasted nuts. Taste is chocolatey and roasted with vanilla and nutty notes.  Also caramel and light chili notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

Chucks 85th, Seattle. Barrel Roller 2017. Lingering ring foam, dark well heavy brown-black. Dark cocoa and coffee nose, heavy with some cinnamon. Lots of cinnamon and its resulting slight spiciness on its first sip. Dark leathery body, medium+ weight but not too thick, some fruity tobacco and cherry skin. Spicy and with some burn. Tasty but missing something, perhaps some balance or finesse. Raisins, fruity-spiced paprika. Nice.

Pours dark with low tanned head 
Aromas of whisky sour, bourbon, vanilla, 
Taste has vinous notes of bourbon, vanilla , whiskey sour, dried fruits
Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, caramel. Taste is rich sweet with a mellow sweet finish. Rich and creamy body with soft carbonation.

Bottled. Full bottle sample. The aroma has nice vanilla and oak tones, roast, dark chocolate, hints of spice. Black coloured beer with a thin, brown head. The taste is light-moderate bitter, has vanilla sweetness, bourbon, roast, dried fruit, chocolate and pepper. Pepper is friendly at first sips but when finishing the bottle the throat burn is low-medium. So stick to half a bottle and this is good (or if you like those burning sensations in your throat you will need about 2 bottles) because the light pepper tones actually do add up in this beer.

Bottle from the dregs run. Cheers Craig. Pours murky brown with no head. Aromas of chocolate, spice and a red wine note. Light vanilla. Taste is light sour, woody, chocolate, boozy, faint smoke. Quite a lot going on.

Bottle, 375ml. Darkest brown color with a surprising head for Flat Abbey, a finger of tan foam that fades to a thick ring. The aroma is nice and complex, bourbz of course, cinnamon, vanilla, roasted chili, booze. Im a sucker for cinnamon/chili stouts, and this is a good one. Nice and balanced, great cinnamon, some sweetness, hot bourbon, bitter coffee, vanilla. Full bodied with high carbonation (wow Tomme, whered this come from?). The heat is on, and you feel it when it goes down, then later you realized youre fecal-faced. Not too shabby from the Abbey.

Aromat: mocny, intensywny, kapitalny. Są w nim bourbon, wanilia, kakao, czekolada, rodzynki, suszone śliwki i fig, pralinki.
Wygląd: ciemnobrunatne, bardzo ładna i stosunkowo wysoka warstwa jasnobrązowej piany, niestety szybko opada.
Smak: niesamowicie bogaty, są tu wiśnie w czekoladzie, śliwki w czekoladzie, czekoladowy likier na bazie bourbonu, kakao i wanilia. Bourbon i chilli, oba bardzo mocne i wyraźne, dobrze kontrują słodką część piwa. Na języku czuć wyraźnie drewniane nuty beczki, w gardle i przełyku pieczenie od chilli. Piwo zmienia się w trakcie brania kolejnego łyka, najpierw są wiśnie w czekoladzie, następnie słodka czekolada, później wchodzą wanilia wraz z ostrym bourbonem, a na koniec palące chilli. Piwo ostre i intensywne,ale mi to akurat odpowiada. Na finiszu piekące chilli, dla części osób to piwo pewnie będzie za ostre. Alkohol ukryty, rozgrzewanie w przełyku i żołądku, cały czas w posmaku czekolada i kakao, chilli mimo wszystko dość ekstremalne. Świetne piwo, bardzo bogate, ciekawe i niezwykle smaczne, oraz bardzo agresywne.

Bottle 375ml. corked @ [ Scooper Tasting ], Ulfborg, Denmark. [ As Lost Abbey My Black Parade ].ABV: 12.0%. Clear dark black brown colour with a large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, sweet malt, spicy, cinnamon, tobacco, coconut - vanilla - bourbon. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, cinnamon, tobacco, dark malt, chocolate, sweet malt, coconut - vanilla - bourbon. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20170303]
 8-4-9-4-15

bottle at home .. black .. massive tan head .. heavy oily meaty malt nose ... dark fruit .. dark chocolate roast ... heavy chocolate malts .. big fruit ,, juicy toffee fruit .. big berries ... soft sweet chocolate malts .. rich raisins .. rich roast .. heavy sweet malts ..
Butelka. W aromacie wanilia, cynamon, lekka paloność. Smak umiarkowanie słodki, lekko wytrawny i ściągający na finiszu. Kawa i czekolada, nuty bourbona.

Rami Rami is drinking a My Black Parade (2016) by The Lost Abbey 
Super waniliowo-kokosowa beczka. W tle czuc jakies stoutowe nuty. Pikantne (za pikantne!) posmaki. Niemalo alko. Niezle cialo, klasa piwo.
Rami Rami: w ramach tla i wwachiwania sie: sos sojowy, pumpernikel, cynamon. czuc tez palonosc. i lukrecje. i mokre drewno.
Rami Rami: no kurde, i migdaly :) po kija oni te papryczki jakies dorzucili? bo ewidentnie sa... one chyba poteguja wrazenie alkoholowosci

Rami Rami: o dziwo z czasem, jak oddycha, ociepla sie do pokojowej - coraz mniej waniliowej beczki (pozostaja te kokosowo-migdalowo-drewniane klimaty)

Draught at Toronado San Diego. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, bourbon, oak, nuts, chocolate, toffee, dark fruits and licorice. Bitter finish with roasted malts, dark fruits, bourbon, oak, toffee, nuts, chocolate and licorice. Exquisite Smerican strong ale.

375ml bottle (thx, Nick M.!). Vintage 2016. Pours an almost black with a dark beige head. Aroma is fruity, spices, bourbon. Taste is chocolate, bourbon, spices. Spices and chocolate aftertaste. Good stuff, despite spices level is on the quite high for me.
Super boozy scent with some tobacco and sweet wood. Blackish brown with am opaque hazy feel. Taste is boozy and clearly 12% with thick mouth sugars. Bottle.

Wspaniałe piwo, genialny aromat bourbonu, który (co ważne!) tylko uzupełnia smak "bazowy", nie dominuje, nie zakrywa, tylko dodaje co ma najlepszego. Drogie okrutnie i być może aż za drogie (mamy i polskie genialne BA), ale trzeba przyznać, że wyśmienite.

1/IV/17 - 37.5cl bottle @ Sebs Short Visit Home Tasting (my home) - BB: n/a (2017-421) Thanks to sebletitje for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark brown beer, creamy beige head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: sweet, vanilla, bourbon notes, alcohol, roasted, spicy, some chocolate. MF: soft carbon, full body. Taste: very roasted, sweet, dried fruits, some vanilla, bourbon, little sourish, alcohol, more alcohol. Aftertaste: bitter, cocoa powder, dry and bit spicy finish. Nice stuff!

On tap at Hops and Pie poured a clear dark reddish brown with a small lingering tan head. Aromas of bourbon, cocoa, vanilla and spice. Palate was medium bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of cocoa, spice, vanilla and light bourbon with a smooth dry lingering spiced cocoa finish.

Bottle from Cap Tap. Pours jet black with an attractive tan head and a chocolate and treacle aroma. There is a rich full-bodied chocolate and dark molasses flavor with some vanilla and a mildly peppery finish. A great sipper.

Bottle shared @Pułapka, Gdańsk
Drank it after Evil Twin Mapple Jesus which puts it in the shadow of that great beer. Very nice bourbon aroma,vanilla and spices,dried fruit
It gives more or less what it promises. Vanilla, chocolate, cocoa, spices, malty sweetness, bit of chilli. It has it all. Awesome beer.

Bouteille 37.5cl via trade in Brussels.
Brune, col crémeux blanc-cassé.
Arôme au nez clairement indiqué par le Bourbon, effet dépices de Noël en rétro, notamment pas mal de cannelle et girofle.
Palais est épais, malté avec une bonne balance du Bourbon, touche dalcool, pointe dépices apportant ne fine touche de chaleur, l tout est complété par leffet de la cannelle. Bourbon revient en retrait avec un effet boisé mais aussi un peu de Bourbon liquide - fond de verre - finemetn huileux.

Bottle sample at a a tasting at troubles place. Thanks Alon. Very dark brown to black. Big aroma of bourbon, vanilla, coconut, chocolate, dark fruits, caramel, nuts, a bit of spiciness. Sweet flavor with bourbon, vanilla, nuts, chocolate, caramel, dark fruits, a bit of spiciness, some booziness, and some hot chili in the finish. Full-bodied. Great.

Vintage 2016, 12% abv. Almost black beer, a head is medium and light brown. Aroma has dried fruits, raisins and dates, liquirice, bourbon and barrel, hint of spicyness and chocolate. Taste has dried fruitness, cinnamon and other spices, bourbon, strenght of alcohol, some darker chocolate-roastiness. Long taste. Maybe there is chilis because the cheeks are starting to warm. Only medium+ bodied, could be more strenght. Huge amount of different flavours but this brewery can manage to keep the balance, as also with this beer.
12.7 oz bottle. Pours black with a very light tan head. Aromas of sweet dark fruit, bourbon and sweet caramel malts. Flavors of same with cinnamon and nutmeg plus doughy malts. A rich cinnamon bun.
Bottle at Cotteridge Wines tasting Cott Botts MkII; dark brown pour with a creamy tan head, aroma has bourbon and sweet cherry, taste has sweet coconut, spice, quite nice.

Pite w Carpe Kraft w ramach panelu. Czarne, nieprzejrzyste z delikatną warstwą drobnopęcherzkowej piany. W aromacie pralinowe, wanilia i przyprawowość. W smaku słodkie, beczka i obecne w aromacie przyprawy z dominującą wanilią.

Butelka pite w domu. Czarne, nieprzejrzyste, piana jasnobrązowa mocna nie opada trzymając się bardzo długo a później zostawia piękne ślady na szkle. Aromat whisky, czekolady i suszonych ciemnych owoców z przewagą śliwek. Smak whisky łagodny, mocno rozgrzewający z owocowymi akcentami .Alkohol ukryty ale mocno rozgrzewa , piwo genialne.

Bottle, 375ml corked, shared by Meilby. Close to black in the glass, topped by a dense, finger-thick dark beige head. The aroma has lots of cocoa nibs and cinnamon, with cardamom. alcohol, coconut, dark chocolate, booze, some coffee, a hint of dried fruits and some oak hints. Its full-bodied, warming and soft on the palate, semi-sweet, with flavors of cocoa nibs, cinnamon, coconut, bourbon, some coffee and dark chocolate and a good sweetness. Everlasting finish with bourbon, cocoa nibs and spices. A true beauty, delicious as hell. 170312

Very dark, no lasting head. Full bodied. Aroma is woody, with dark fruits and malts and vanilla. Much more going on in the mouth - coca cola caramel, vanilla, toasted malt, subtle cinnamon, slightly less subtle chilli at the finish. Very decent.

Bottle, poured to the Teku.

Very intensive dessert cocoa, dark chocolate, a little bit of roastiness and some bourbon vanilla in nose.

Pours muddy, very dark brown to jet black. Ultra hazy. Minimal to none beige head.

Bourbon all the way through, dark belgian chocolate with bourbon infused. Spices. Dark dessert cocoa. Medium to heavy sweetness, medium bitterness.

Medium to full bodied, medium texture. At first very fizzy, but then the carbon dioxide dissapears. Long chocolate-spicy-bourbon finish.

Nice but the spices are annoying for me.

Black pour with a thin beige head and very light lacing ..... deep aroma of oak, cinnamon, vanilla, chocolate, bourbon, anise/cardamom and coconut .... taste is of cocoa, bourbon, vanilla, oak, coconut, spicy cinnamon, cardamom, tobacco and slightly nutty with some dry bitter peppery heat on the back end and an influence of dark fruits/berries  .... these guys just have a mastery of rich oaky flavors in beers and there is a lot of depth and complexity .... mouthfeel is soft .... finish is spicy, with lingering pepper, vanilla, oak, chocolate and tobacco ... big beer abv hidden well .... solid

Dark brown pour with small beige head. Aroma of bourbon, fruits, chocolate, cinnamon, vanilla and tobacco. Taste of chocolate fudge, bourbon, vanilla, oak, dark fruits, toffee and a slight chili spice on the finish. Full bodied, lower carbonation, creamy mouthfeel, nicely balanced.
@Ulfborg Scooper. Nearly black, small beige head. Syrupy aroma, light coffee and licorice and bourbon. Sweetish flavour, slightly boozy, syrupy and woody. Nice and very drinkable.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are bourbon, roast malt, chocolate, spices, hops, candy sugar and has a nice sweet finish.

Bottle, 12%. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, spices, cinnamon and oak. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, chocolate, spices, cinnamon, oak, sweet, warming, notes, vanilla, bourbon, hop and medium bitter.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Almost black with a small light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, spicy, tobacco, vanilla and bourbon. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. Oily. 030317

March 3, 2017. Bottle at home. 
Black with a medium sized frothy and quickly dissipating tan head. Aroma is roasted, malty and spicy with dark roast coffee, cocoa, bourbon, earthy tobacco, cardamom, a touch of cinnamon and bourbon. 
Taste is medium sweet, smooth bitter, spicy and light warming. Medium to full bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation. Finish is roasted coffee grounds, light spicy with a dry earthy and slight nutty note, sweet caramel and light warming bourbon, very light chili hint as well.

W aromacie ciemne owoce, kokos, wanilia, czekolada, nuty drewniane, beczka bo bourbonie robi mega robotę. W smaku ciemne owoce mieszają się z czekoladą, wanilią, cynamonem. Alkohol rozgrzewa przełyk, ale jest ewidentnie szlachetny i idealnie pasuje do całości.

Aroma: cocoa, cinnamon, vanilla, smoked chili pepper, oak
Taste: medium sweet, cocoa, cinnamon, chili, oak, vanilla, coconut

Egyszerűen imádom a Lost Abbey nagy formátumú söreit, amelyek a színárnyalatok sötétedésével nyújtanak egyre monumentálisabb élményt, így egy american strong ale már csak annak rendszerinti tónusa miatt is rengeteg jóval kecsegtet. A főzdénél az érlelésen túl remekül értenek a fűszerezéshez is, a kettő találkozása ezúttal sem meglepő módon mesteri módon valósult meg. A karamellás színezetű, alkoholban úszó fadongák mennyeien krémes, vaníliás-kókuszos karaktere viszi a prímet, a bársonyos kakaó édesen puha foszlányai simogatják jámboran a szerkezetet, majd a vibrálóan fűszeres körítés izgalmas jegyei korbácsolják fel a kedélyeket. Csakúgy, ahogyan az élénk kortyok karamelles, csokoládés, kakaós vonalait a jogosan elvárt vanília és kókusz faháncsos elemei vastagítják, majd továbbhaladva az ízek rejtelmeibe, némi füstös, dohánnyal kevert csípőspaprika sziporkázóan pikáns karaktere is feltárul végül. Nem az a szirupos fenevad, de nem is az a finomkodó, sejtelmes ízvilág; az ízjegyek bombaként robbannak, de nem tolakodóak; elegáns, de nem egysíkú; nem sok mindent leplez, mégsem faragatlan; tagadhatatlanul Lost Abbey, vérbeli american strong ale.
Im not 13 years old!! .. . Dark brown .. Spice, burnt bark,old bourbon, and rejection .. Pretty mundane, very Lost Abbey .. . . Inception, but for cats

9th February 2017Level 42 Bottleshare. Almost opaque dark brown beer, small tan head. Palate is light, dry and has decent fine carbonation. Nice dark chocolate malts, vanilla. Mild chilli spice. Good fruit bourbon. More spice. Light dry spicy finish. Light dry spicy finish. Punchy BA flavours delivered on a notably light palate. Very nice.

Bottle
Aroma-bourbon, vanilla, coconut, spices, chilli, caramel
Appearance-black, hazy, tan foam
Taste-medium bitter, medium sweetness, light sour, spicy
Palate-full body, oily, average carbonation, long finish
Overall-perfect

Bottled. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of toasted malt, dark fruit, caramel, spice, chili, wood, alcohol, vanilla and bourbon. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry and with a little bitterness. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Ale indeed. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

February 2017 - Bottle share at One Canada Square, with big thanks to Kenny. As Lost Abbey My Black Parade, 12%, zombie bride picture. Opaque black with a foamy brown head. Aroma is After Eight mints, spearmint, chocolate. Body is smooth, tingly carbonation, a little frothy. Taste has more After Eight mints, sugary, brandy, mint, cardamom and cinnamon in the finish. Pretty nice stuff in small amounts. (3.9)

Ciemne, nieprzejrzyste. Świetny waniliowy aromat, lekko słodki, delikatny. W smaku czekolada, znowu dużo wanilii, przyprawy, trochę kawy. Na drugim planie beczka, świetnie skomponowana, ale nie dominuje. Delikatnie rozgrzewa, ale alkohol właściwie niewyczuwalny. Piwo jest bardzo lekkie, pije się doskonale, bardzo przyjemnie. Nie jest zaklejające i zbyt gęste, ale mimo tego intensywność smaków i doznań jest ogromna. Wspaniałe.
Wonderful rich aroma of bourbon barrel (more wood than alcohol). Dark with low carbonation. Vanilla and cocoa in the testy. Close to RIS profile. Exquisite!

38cl bottle shared in CW. Many thanks to Ken for this one. It pours a deep dark brown color with a beige head. Aroma is very herbal with big chocolate and mint notes. Taste is also very sweet with light complex herbal notes, some more mint and chocolate and vanilla and bourbon and chillies. Medium to full bodied with good carbonation. Overall, very interesting and complex

Bottle care of Kenny. It pours jet black with a decent tan head. The aroma is soft, sweet, chocolate cake, creamy, soft, toasty brown sugar and soft warming spice. The taste is soft, sweet, toasty, chocolate cake, warming spice, wood, booze, vanilla, nutmeg, wood, nougat, toasty, spice with a drying finish. Full body and moderate carbonation. Soft, sweet and boosty. Fun stuff.

Bottle shared on Level 42 09/2017. Many thanks to Kenny for this one. A dark black brown coloured pour with a halo of dark tan head. Aroma is dark choc, coconut, bourbon, oak, vanilla. Flavour is composed of red berry, bourbon, vanilla, toasted coconut, vanilla, oak, mint, . Some hot alcohol in the finish. Palate is medium full, sweet, prickly carbonation. Frorhy. Tasty. Pudding. Warming alcohol.

Bottle split at L42, big thanks to Kenny, 09/02/17
Extremely dark mahogany brown with a decent beige cap.
Nose is earthy malt, chocolate, spice, bourbon, toffee fudge,fruit cake.
Taste comprises black pepper, chocolate melt, green peppery spice, oak, spice, light herb, toffee, dark fruit rinds.
Full bodied, fine carboantion, semi drying close with a rising boost and subtle bourbon tang.
Solid stuff.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared in London - many thanks to Mitchy. Pours oily black-brown with a creamy, tan head. Nice aroma, vanilla, a little mint, rich chocolate. Medium sweet flavour with gooey chocolate, mellow roast, some burnt wood, vanilla, marshmallows. Full bodied, chewy, with fine carbonation. Warming finish, with more oily vanilla, rich chocolate, mild roast, more charred marshmallows. Some rich, dried berries. Drinks real good. Very, very good.

Bottle share at Level 42. Big thanks to Ken. Pours dark black Brown with thin dirty head. Aroma is coconut, coffee and booze. Taste is coconut, a little chilli, chocolate and coffee. Smooth carbonation. Lovely

Ależ beczka w aromacie ! Drewno, wanilia, kokos, nuty whiskey. W smaku pełne, szlachetnie alkoholowe, czuć potężnie beczkę, jak i gorzkie, suche kakao. Finisz pikantny, przyprawowy, lekko tytoniowy. Mała bitelka to bez mała dobre pół godziny degustacyjnej uczty.
On tap at Beercraft. Pours a black color with a bit of head. Chocolate malty aroma. Strong unsweetened chocolate flavor. Overpowers a little. Hot.
Rewelacyjna praca beczki po Bourbonie! Szlachetne alko, wanilia, kokos. Do tego ciemne owoce, czekolada. Pyszne, znakomicie się to pije!
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is caramel, bourbon, light chocolate, cinnamon, oak, taste is sweet, chewy, toffee, vanilla, spices, light chilli.

Bottle. Pitch black with moderate, light brown, semi-thick head. Poor head retention and lacing. Moderate bourbon, vanilla and oaky notes. Some raisins, dark sugar and dark fruits. Taste is semi-sweet to sweet, just a little bitterness in the end. Hints of cinnamon in the background. Medium body, watery to oil texture, lively carbonation, finish is boozy, bourbon, flat. Good brew, but needs some improvements - first of all need some time to stay in the bottle for a while to hide the ABV. Carbonation is too high and in overall palate should be improved - thicker, fuller and not so annoying. Beside this, this is another example the Lost Abbey know what to do with freshly emptied bourbon barrel - like in other beers the bourbon note are really up-front, strong and impressive, along with some raisins and oak character.

Pours black into a snifter. Creamy mocha head with excellent retention recedes to coat surface. Chocolate, vanilla and hot chili aromas. Dark hot chocolate, bourbon and vanilla upfront turning to warming put fruit and pepper in the lasting finish
375-ml bottle from craftbeertemple. roasty sweet musty nose, good crackly head that just sat there, chocolate, chile, cinnamon, booze, medium body. cork flew 242 in.
January 13, 2017 - bottle from Binnys. Black pour with some head. Aroma was chocolate, vanilla, light bourbon and spice. Taste was heavy on the spice with the other flavors mixed in the background.

Some a 375ml bottle shared by Yaniv. Pours an opaque dark brown colored brew with an average sized tan head that quickly dissipates and leaves behind a film top and a thin off-white ring. Aroma of black licorice, bourbon, Bakers chocolate, raisin and a touch of pipe tobacco. Taste is full bodied, with flavors of chocolate and vanilla notes, raisin, a hint of anise, and dark berries. Finish is semi-sweet, a touch of booze and earthy spice.

Bottle Pours black with a ring of tan head. Aroma of vanilla, brownie, chocolate, cinnamon. Flavor of black cardamom, chocolate, whiskey, anise. Finish is off with the spice coming on too strong. Mouthfeel is medium.

Bottle thanks to Yaniv! Deep brown pour with a small head. Nose is spicy. Vanilla, cardamom, pepper. Some bourbon. Flavor is balanced. Earthy, spicy char. Wood. Sweet chocolate and a bit of blackberry. Full body, oily. Solid.

Sampled from the bottle thanks to Yaniv! Pours near black with a tan head that dissipates quickly and near completely. Aroma has bourbon and dark grains with a light spice note supporting. Flavor has earthy dark grains, light spice with a touch if roast and bourbon supporting.
Dark black pour with a tan head. Nice chocolate, spice and some bourbon. Really nice.
Bottle. Very good aroma. Some cardamom, and lots of bourbon. Flavor is dry, more cardamom here, and bourbon in the flavor as well.
12oz bottle shared by Yanif, thanks. Dark brown pour. Aroma is bourbon and pumpkin spice. Taste is kind of muddled but boozy spice is nice. Delicious.
Bottle shared by Yaniv - thanks! Dark brown pour with a minor head. Big aroma of molasses, cocoa, vanilla, wood, cardamom. Taste is slightly hot, maybe a little muddled, but good.

375ml c&c bottle from Xroads. Poured a medium to slightly thicker black body under a large foamy deep beige head. Aroma is solid, chocolate, cinnamon, bourbon, vanilla, tobacco, barrel, and booze. Flavor takes it up a notch. Sort of a bourbon soaked lightly burnt piece of cinnamon raisin toast, chocolate, dark fruits. Body is medium to slightly thicker with average carbonation and a rather well hidden ABV that only leaves heat once the beer temp really starts warming up.
375ml bottle. Poured a black color with a smaller sized tan head. Chocolate, spices, bourbon, and some oaky woodiness.
Poured into 6oz glass. Nice burbon n bouquet. Start to get taste of star anise, licorice, green peppers and some smoke. Quite a bit of warming alcohol and quite balanced l. Nice!

Shared 12.7 oz. bottle poured to a snifter, showing a darkest brown color, with a presentably persistent, tan head, with dots & dashes of lacing. The aroma was roasted, cocoa, barrel, and spices, with a touch of vanilla, and hints of earthiness, greenery, & veg that may have been the chilies working on my nose. Medium to full bodied, with soft carbonation, the taste was similar, some sticky texture, and bourbony warmth.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured black color with a moderate frothy tan head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy toasted malt, spice, wood with an alcohol aroma. Full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Heavy bourbon wood and malt sweet flavor with a heavy bittersweet finish of long duration. This is a standout beer.

Black with a light chocolate head. Aroma is liquorice, cherries, plum, fig, chocolate, cinnamon, molasses. Full bodied, viscous mouthfeel, lightly sweet with a lightly spicy, warming finish. Taste is cherries, chocolate, bourbon, cinnamon, liquorice, coffee, plum, hint of spice.

375 ml bottle shared with Tmoney99 and Chris R. Pours dark brown to black in color with a small plus sized khaki colored head. The aroma and flavor have big spice character over the roasted malts, chocolate, and bourbon, some oak, the peppers kick in mid palate, finishes a touch soft but still pretty good.

375mL bottle, pours jet black with a small brown head. Aroma is decadent, with notes of cinnamon, cardamom, vanilla and bourbon upfront. Flavour is super decadent, with lots of vanilla, bourbon and spices upfront; the spices seems to be cinnamon and cardamom, with subdued cocoa. Boozy but not abrasive as such, with a great integration of all the flavours. Excellent.

Bottle shared with Annie as is tradition. Sexy foil label from old man Arthur. Pours a deep blackish color with minimal head. Nose is fire, black sharpie, tobacco, cocoa. Flavor is root beer slurpee, boozy dark fruit, ash, Toffee, and cardamom. Medium to fuller mouthfeel with lighter carb and lighter stickiness. Warming as hell in the chest
bottle pour dark with no head. minimal carbonation. strong bourbon barrel notes (oak, booze), vanilla, cinnamon. medium to full body. booze burn.
(Bottle) clear, bright very dark brown colour with a small brown head; aroma of dried fruit, brown sugar, candied fruit, spice; balanced flavour with a long, light bitter and sweet finish

On tap at Fire On The Mountain - Denver. Black appearance with a small, lingering tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, cardamom, bourbon and light oak. Similar flavor, rich and heavily spiced at first, with a note of licorice/anise. It mellows out as it warms up and there is a light vanilla note with a touch of smoke and a slight chili pepper finish. Fully body. A little rough at first but it was nice, complex and smooth as it warmed up. Well done.
375ml 2016 release. Aroma is oak, bourbon. Taste is oak and booze forward. Dark cocoa powder. Lots of baking spices cinnamon, anise, cardamom.

Black hue under a thin light tan foamy cap. Big outrageously delicious chocolate aroma with brown sugary bourbon and vanilla, and a gentle berry tone. Smooth dark cocoa flavor with big vanilla and coconut and oak flavors with brown sugary bourbon and some sort of spice cake nuances on the end. Light herbal kiss in the bourbonny sweet chocolaty finish with a smack of earthy sweet vanilla, and toasted coconut throughout.

Dark brown/black color; Medium to heavy creamy body; Aroma of toasted sweet malt, cocoa/chocolate, some caramel, & spice; Flavor of roasted/smoky sweet malt, oak, rich chocolate/cocoa, vanilla/caramel, some dark fruit notes, and cinnamon/spice; Warm finish; Nicely balanced; This was very satisfying - but I was expecting a little more though.

Draft @ Toronado San Diego, San Diego, CA. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a slightly roasted malty woody bourbon chocolate aroma with hints of dark fruit. Slightly roasted malty woody dark fruit flavor with hints of bourbon and vanilla. Slightly roasted malty woody caramel and dark fruit finish with hints of bourbon and vanilla.
Bottle - Woody and some smoke with bourbon notes. Jet black with a rich light brown head. Vanilla and coconut with some nice sweetness and bourbon boozy notes. OK nose, but tastes great.

Now this is black with a tiny foam head. Aroma is chocolate and pipe tobacco. I dont find this spicy and the alcohol hides itself well. I do find this to be rich in flavors. Between the vanilla, bourbon, and cocoa, this is an excellent beer that finishes with a touch of fruit and oak.

375, corked and baled. Pours a thick opaque matte black with a dense and creamy burnt tan head that fades away quickly. Big chocolatey nose, smells like mexican hot chocolate--like the commercial description says, theres cinnamon and oak there as well. Creamy thick body, heavy. Some moderate carb pokes through, with effort. Chocolate, cinnamon, oak, and vanilla on the mid palate. Long sweet finish.

Draught at Toronado, San Diego. Black beer with a nice beige head. Malty caramel aroma, licorice, raisins, figs, caramel, some brown sugar. Malty caramel flavor, bourbon, cinnamon, grapes, raisins, slightly boozy. Very good though.

(En fût à Mohawk Bend): Richesse chocolatée sans (bon, quelques uns quand même) précédent, de la vanille fondante, des cendres, de la cannelle et une sécheresse crayeuse et même pas si chaude que ça. Ça faisait longtemps quun sipper mavait pas impressionné comme ça.

Bottle at Culmination Fest 16: Poured a dark brown marble with a tan head. Aroma was boozy, rich in roasted malts, light spices of cinnamon. Taste was a bold blend of alcohol, malts, tobacco, vanilla, spicy, some sweetness.

$40 750mL bottles from the release sampled at two different tastings. The first bottle was more impressive with greater adjunct intensity. Clear deep brown looking black pour with thick mocha mousse. Nose is spicy hot chocolate, cinnamon schnapps, ground cardamom, rich bourbon. Outstanding. Taste is really solid spicy hot chocolate, bourbon warming, tremendous body that is oily and rich, never too sweet or dusty. This one is approaching BA Abraxas. Second, later bottle is still kicking though more sweet bourbon in the aroma losing some of that cardamom spice finesse.

750ml bottle pours out dark brown almost black topped with a tan head. nose is bourbon barrel cinnamon cardamom chili peppers spice and chocolate roast malts. Taste is more of the cinnamon chocolate chili peppers spice along with the bourbon barrel goodness.
Thin brown pour. Nose is yogurt, some coffee. Taste is yogurt, light chocolate, cinammon, chile spice. Thin watery mouthfeel.

750ml bottlle acquired via trade on BA. Thanks, bro. A really fun beer that Im glad to have gotten. Pours a deeper, dark blackish brown hue, stout like in appeal. Dark and ominous, an opaque body with thicker legs on the swirl. Some brownish glow on the edges and bottom with frothy and alluring brownish creamy head atop. A full film with thicker ringer laces sufficiently. Aromas show firm barrel, vanilla and spirit mesh with chocolate, marshmellow and subtle coconut. Richer oak appeal is flavorful and deep as toasty and roasty malts support sweeter caramel base, biscuits and jabs of chocolate. Subtle spiciness, more oak but not an assault of heat or spirit. Dark and deep, rich with subtle brandy, firm whiskey and toast, vanilla and subtle marshmellow appeal. Nice stuff as that cinnamon gives just a subtle flourish, growing slowly as it warms and settles. Initial is fuller bodied overall, a good oaky presence softens the blow with tannic appeal, sufficient carbonation, caramel and toast, roast and subtle char meet gentle cocoa and chocolate. Softened tannic vanilla and softer creamy sweetness still lives on a bit despite the barrel time. A bit of warmth, caramel, rich oak and subtle vinous character grows. A bit of coconut, chocolate and subtle cinnamon as we start to round the corner. Sufficient body to hold up to the barrel but not lacking on influence from it. Earthiness, vinous, and some subtle leather and tobacco depth is fleeting but tucked between those richer oak and cocoa flavors, vanilla and gentle warmth. Subtle peppery life is earthy, dark fruit and rich flavors overall. A firmer body holds up but the flavors and additions add depth, complexity, potent flavors. A bit of stickiness gives it the feel of a beer that held up strong but still has a potent oak character. Subtle cinnamon, nibs and gentle spicy peppery appeal. Really enjoyable and expertly aged stuff. A pretty pour, potent deep nose, great flavors and flow. A true example of barrel aging and holding up a think. A rich barrel flavor, expert timing and a great subtle addition of spices. This one is full yet pretty drinkable, full of flavor, a good flow and just really great stuff, I think. Well done, Lost Abbey. This is a reminder of your past and all the expertise you have because of it.
This one is an odd one. Spices and wood all over a base, and surprise surprise its low carbonation. Oh well, MEH.

Bottle. Dark brown/black pour with a kaki head. Tasty beer. Hard to put my finger on much other than the spices and chilies. Its good but undefinable for me. Good body and mouthfeel. Barrel backbeats.

750 mL bottle. Black body. Smells strongly of cinnamon. Roasted malt. I get cardamom. Lots of spices in general. Tastes of lots of cardamom. Bourbon. Cinnamon. Some chocolate. Light chiles. Boozy, but not heavy. Well carbonated. I thought this would be a mess, but it works really well.

Shared at first sunday. Oh man, was not sure what to expect with this but really pleasantly surprised. So much going on here with a lot of different spices but all subtle and working together really well. Chili pepper spice at first and a little hot. Vanilla working to smooth things out a bit. Lots of chocolate malt and a gritty cocoa and milk chocolate finish. Getting more cinnamon now as it warms a bit.

Bottle. Dark brown/black pour, with a thin tan head. Heavily spiced, heavily boozy, bourbon, rum, alcohol heat, vanilla, and milk chocolate. The body is a bit thin. Ok, too much spice really and boozy.
Deep brown color, tan head. Awesome beer. The bourbon and chocolate notes play amazingly well with the spices. Really good stuff.

Bottle thanks to Dan. Pours a very dark brown with small beige head that lasts. The aroma is strong spice, bourbon, chocolate. Medium mouth, rich roasted malt, chocolate, light spice, nice booze, very nice.
